review_content:
칭따오 퓨어드래프트는 PURE DRAFT : 순수한 날것, 즉 완전한 생맥주라는 말이다보니 당연히 고급 라인일 것이고 맛도 더 좋을것이다라고 기대를 하게 되는데..

대체 이 맥주는 무슨 맛이 남은걸까, 퓨어라는 말대로 모든게 순수한 물으로 바꿔버린걸까요. 재미도 없고 맛도 없고 그냥 탄산수를 마시는 느낌.

내가 지금 마시는게 무슨 맛인지 잘 모를땐 입안 가득 채워보는 편인데.. 순간 이것이 바로 깨끗한 이느낌 하이트다! 누가누가 맥주를 아무맛 안나게 잘 만들까 천하제일무맛대회 열렸더라구요.

물론 평소 탄산수를 즐기는데 알콜이 들어있지않아 아쉽다는 분은 이제 이걸 드시면 됩니다. 라벨은 보니 알콜 도수도 줄었네요.

양심없게도 대체 왜 오리지널보다 맛없게 만든걸까.. 캔 위를 보면 쓰레기 버리지말고 재활용 똑바로 하라고 적혀있는데 넘 맛이 없어서 쓸모없는 말을 하는 모습.
Very light malt and hops, very low bitterness, very refreshing, mild, thirst-quenching, with a hint of malt grain sweetness.

Bottiglia. Il naso riconosce indizi di orzo e di riso. L'olfatto viene stimolato in maniera normale e il modo in cui permane è sufficiente. Il manto birroso superiore ha una scarsa tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di consistenza limpida. Il colore è giallo paglierino. Il corpo è medio e acquoso. L'amaro è moderato. La forza gustativa è normale e si prolunga in modo sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. Il finale è semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. Il tetto della bocca porta impressioni di miele, erbaceo e riso.
Tastes like a corn on the cob blended with a bland lager. Drinkable! Not much to say about this one.

Can. Light yellow, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light corn, faint fruitiness and alcohol. Body is light, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, light corn and faint fruitiness and alcohol. Finish is short, malty and lightly sweetish, light corn and faint cardboard, faint fruitiness and really faint hoppyness, faint alcohol. Watery lager. Tastes really cheap.
330ml bottle. Pours pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is rice, sweet malt, cardboard. Taste is watery, grainy, rice, quite gassy. It could be worse.
The foam stability is medium, body light. The Aroma is malty, light bitter, flowery. The taste is malty, light, a bit hoppy. Ok for a Pale Lager.

Bottled 330ml (Prisma Mikkola)

Pale yellow colour, small white head. Cooked corn, cardboard in the nose. Light-bodied. Fizzy, watery, some corn, cardboard in the flavour. Rubbish industrial sweetcorn lager. I can't remember normal Tsingtao as skunky as this one.

Bottle in Luoyang, China. Poured a crystal clear gold with 5mm of bright white open foam that diminished quickly to a blotchy cap that laced OK. Carbonation moderate, average and medium to coarse. Aroma of semi-sweet malt and corn; no obvious hops. Taste of semi-sweet malt; no bitterness. Light body. Smooth, crisp and refreshing if cold with a thin mouthfeel. Very similar to Tsingtao and many other Chinese pale lagers.
From a big bottle in a restaurant in Shanghai. It was fairly cold but not much else going on. Cheap.

Can 50cl. as Pure Draft, from 7 Eleven at Soy Street, Kowloon, @hotel poured into a shaker. Clear pale golden, small fizzy white head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; aroma sweet malts, corn, rice; taste medium sweet and slightly bitter, malty, grainy, bready; light body, watery texture, soft carbonation: not very distinct from the normal Tsingtao but lighter and more watery.
At the Backstabber’s tasting, 5%. Pours yellow with no head, aroma of fruits, grain, caramel, flavor of corn, malt, light bodied

I drank this beer yesterday at Shanghai, in a popular restaurant. It is a typical beer from a macrobrewery. It is drinkable, yellow body, average carbonation, I think that you have mainly rice, some malt or syrup of malt, few hop, thin and white foam.
En af de bedre kinesiske øl - med stadig alt for tynd og sjasket. Prisen på ca 1 kr er dog tiltalende - og billigere ned vand
"a slightly thinner, fizzier and skunkier version of Tsingtao. Didn’t even go well with chinese food. I’ll pass from now on, this is chinese macro lager at it’s worst."
칭따오 퓨어드래프트는 PURE DRAFT : 순수한 날것, 즉 완전한 생맥주라는 말이다보니 당연히 고급 라인일 것이고 맛도 더 좋을것이다라고 기대를 하게 되는데..…
Very light malt and hops, very low bitterness, very refreshing, mild, thirst-quenching, with a hint of malt grain sweetness.

Bottiglia. Il naso riconosce indizi di orzo e di riso. L'olfatto viene stimolato in maniera normale e il modo in cui permane è sufficiente. Il manto birroso superiore ha una scarsa tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di consistenza…
Tastes like a corn on the cob blended with a bland lager. Drinkable! Not much to say about this one.

Can. Light yellow, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light corn, faint fruitiness and alcohol. Body is light, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, light corn and faint fruitiness and alcohol. Finish is short, malty and…
330ml bottle. Pours pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is rice, sweet malt, cardboard. Taste is watery, grainy, rice, quite gassy. It could be worse.
The foam stability is medium, body light. The Aroma is malty, light bitter, flowery. The taste is malty, light, a bit hoppy. Ok for a Pale Lager.
Bottled 330ml (Prisma Mikkola) Pale yellow colour, small white head. Cooked corn, cardboard in the nose. Light-bodied…

Bottle in Luoyang, China. Poured a crystal clear gold with 5mm of bright white open foam that diminished quickly to a blotchy cap that laced OK. Carbonation moderate, average and medium to coarse. Aroma of semi-sweet malt and corn; no obvious hops.…
From a big bottle in a restaurant in Shanghai. It was fairly cold but not much else going on. Cheap.

Can 50cl. as Pure Draft, from 7 Eleven at Soy Street, Kowloon, @hotel poured into a shaker. Clear pale golden, small fizzy white head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; aroma sweet malts, corn, rice; taste medium sweet and slightly bitter, malty, grainy, bready;…
At the Backstabber’s tasting, 5%. Pours yellow with no head, aroma of fruits, grain, caramel, flavor of corn, malt, light bodied

I drank this beer yesterday at Shanghai, in a popular restaurant. It is a typical beer from a macrobrewery. It is drinkable, yellow body, average carbonation, I think that you have mainly rice, some malt or syrup of malt, few hop, thin and white foam.
En af de bedre kinesiske øl - med stadig alt for tynd og sjasket. Prisen på ca 1 kr er dog tiltalende - og billigere ned vand
"a slightly thinner, fizzier and skunkier version of Tsingtao. Didn’t even go well with chinese food. I’ll pass from now on, this is chinese macro lager at it’s worst."
Bottle from Chantal in China. Nose is malt and slight skunk; pours a clear straw, zero head. Taste is watery, light mouthfeel, bready/ricey taste. Aight, if you are in China i guess.
refreshing and nice. That it is all there is to say. Clear golden frature and oldy good if very cold.
Yellow color , small white head. Minimal skunky and grainy aroma. Malty taste . Watery . Aftertaste is absent.
Aroma is mildly skunkiness and grains. The flavor is grains, mild sweetness and a slightly tart finish.
Bottle 33cl, A clear yellow beer with medium head. Nose is typical lager like, aroma is very low, low hops, low malt, very boring, nice label but nothing more except poor wet paper on aftertaste.
500ml can. Pale yellow color. No head. Absolutely bland, watery stuff. Thanks to my friend who bothered to bring me this from China. Never again.

500ml can - thanks Ares!

Sake hints in the utterly bland aroma. I know why - this is made from rice. Watery and fizzy like soda water. Incredibly bland, and fizzes in the mouth like a soda too. Finish is ricey and soda watery. Incredibly pale and fizzy. Papery once the fizz goes down. Not good.

Bottled (thanks bored). Goldeny pale amber colour, small head. Aroma is rice, mild malts, some slight herbs and mild rubbery notes, Flavour is maize, rice and some malts with some strange sweetness as well. Not all too bad, although quite rough.
Had in Chinatown on Chinese New Year. Well, it is an asia pale lager. It is light bodied, lightly hopped, and lightly flavored. Didn’t have a lot of weird adjunct flavor. Serving: Bottle

Bottle. Pours pale yellow with a small fizzy white head that disappears quickly with little lacing. Aroma is hay, corn syrup, cardboard, metal. Flavor is much the same, lightly sweet, light bitterness, metallic finish. Light body.
Wow this beer is aweful no flavor, a little aroma of hops but barely this beer only gets a 0.9 because its better than bud and bud light. Only get if you want to rate!
Bottle. Clear pale yellow pour, small white head. Nose is a bit skunky. Thin palate. Just another bad grainy lager.

Bottle @ Ramada hotel, Kunshan. Pours light yellow with a fast fading white head. Aroma of corn, rice, light notes of straw. Taste is sweet with corn and rice, some carboard later on. Thin body, low carbonation. 130112

Can’t say I know where to get it, because their distributor was a sponsor of a trivia bowl I was in, put on by the Asian American Journalists Association. At least I can say a light lager does indeed go well with spicy Asian food. Pours a decent lager yellow color. An okay beer at first seems like there are malts in the front. Taste is on the sugary side, but still close to style. At least it cools me after some chili chicken and bao rolls.
Glad I didn’t both with a full bottle of this, just had a taste from a plastic cup at the grocery store. Nothing too offensive but nothing worth revisiting, either.

(330ml bottle thanks to the ever-reliable pale lager provider, Fratto) clear pale yellow with soapy white bubbles. Nose is stinky, skunky, and some toasty grain. Taste of old grain, paper, skunky, and just bad. Grainy linger.

Pours a watery yellow with no head whatsoever...looks dead.  Aroma of hay and faint alcohol.  Flavor is also like hay.  Mouthfeel is watery up front but shockingly gets a little lively at the finish which is abrupt (thankfully).  This beer truly sucks.

Pours goldish yellow, thin white head. Very little smell, some pale malts.  It is easy to drink with no off putting flavors, there just isn’t much flavor at all, little to no hops noticed. Very good water tho, clean and crisp. Good with lighter asian food, not spicy stuff, it is too thin for that.

11.2oz bottle @ Walt Disney World vacation at Epcot Nine Dragons. Low expectation pale lager were met. Light colored watery yellow pour with head. Taste is wet grass, rye and malts. Similiar to the Tsingtao regular.

The beer pours a light clear yellow color with a white head. The aroma is exactly what I expected from an imported beer in a green bottle: skunked grain and nothing else. I am holding it against the brewer in my rating since it was their choice to use a green bottle. The flavor has some light skunk notes as well as some grass and grain. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

bottle pours very light yellow with a thin white head that fades fast to nothing.  Aroma is skunky with cat piss and sweet cereals.  Flavor is sour and extremely thin.  Thin ceareals and a sour finish of lingering cereals.  Eh.

Ein sehr leichtes Bier, allerdings nur wenig wässrig. Kurz herb im Antrunk, Mittelteil leicht hopfig,wirkt recht trocken. Eine im Antrunk auftretendeSüße wird über den Mittelteil im Nachgeschmack kräftiger, ein bitteres Aroma löst dies ab. Könnte würziger sein. 	 
Test vom 16.10.2006, Gebinde: Dose 	Noten: 3,7,9,8,10,8 - 7,60

bottle thanks to cavie.  i can’t believe fratto didn’t rate this higher.  poured clear yellow wit a soapy white head.  aroma was skunk and flavor was nothing at all.  light body with low carbonation.  maybe my worst beer to date.
bottle, provided by Cavie, clear thin yellow color with strong skunked aroma, flavor is a little better with some sweet Karo
Bottle.  Light pour with a white head.  Aroma is skunky even from several feet away.  Taste is toe cheese and sweet, sweet skunk.
Bottle from Gabriels in San Antonio via Fratto. Clear straw yellow color. White bubbly head. Huge skunk odor with tainted grain and grossness. Flavor is soured grains, water and metal. Gross.
(330ml bottle, from Fratto)  Pours a clear pale yellow with a small fizzy white head.  Aroma of grass, skunk, and stinky feet (nasty toe gum).  Flavor cereal, grass, and skunk.

Bottle @ home.  Incredibly light yellow and very clear appearance with a tiny white head.  Skunky aroma, even from several feet away made up of some light pale malts.  Body is incredibly light pale malty and very watery.  Some skunkiness and even more devoid of flavor than most American light beers.  Crap.

2010 Walt Disney World vacation at Epcot Nine Dragons. Bottle to glass pour is golden yellow with a white soapy head. Scents of light grass and subtle malt. Taste is crisp bubbly water with some grassy malt and finishes dry and crisp.

Poured a very light yellow with almost no head.  Aroma is very skunky with rice and pale malts.  Taste is better than the aroma.  Flavors of pale malts with not much else, but not very skunky.  Slightly sweet up front but with a bitter finish.  Smooth throughout.  Not as bad as I expected!
Well, it is not as bad as I feared. Bottle pours clear yellow with almost no head. Musty metallic like scent. Taste is lightly sweet with a dry cornish? finish.

Shared with svoger and beerbiker at my bicycle weekend debut. Brought home from China by big daddy. Pale yellow, small white head. Almost no aroma, unlycky undertaste of corn and cardboard with a sweet almost cloying flavor.

Liter bottle from asian market in Seattle. Palest pour on a beer I’ve ever seen, minimal white head, looks like pale ginger ale. Nose is whiff of vinegar and grain/corn. Taste has some honey-like sweetness but otherwise fizzy corny malting. Sweetness is nice, works to cut spicy asian food, but pretty terrible otherwise. Serves its purpose.

Yellow colored with vanishing white head. Sweet and grainy aroma with some grassy-lemony note, some cardboard also comes up. Thin to medium bodied. More cardboard in start of flavor, lemon and sweetness last in aftertaste.
Really good and better than the other Tsingtao.  Another vacation brew that I had at Disney World.  It was light and with a good finish.  Very refreshing, though it was 90 & humid.....
Can. Mild grainy aroma. Thin mouthfeel. Mild grainy flavour with a mild bitter touch, bit dry. My thanks to Tooru’s friend, Imura-san, for giving me this one.

can. clear yellow, almost no head.
faint sweet aroma.
 flavor is sweet, spritty.

Name: Pure Draft Beer

Date: August 08, 2009

Mode: Bottle

Source: Tasting, Ticker

Appearance: clear pale yellow, wispy white head, bits of lace

Aroma: sweet corn aroma, light floral hops

Flavor: light sweet malt flavor, light cereal character, nice floral hops, just a touch of balancing bitterness

Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 8/20

Rating: 2.2/5.0
Drinkability: 6/10

Score: *+/4

Multiple 12oz bottles at Lao Shanghi - China Town Chicago.  Pours a clear lighter yellow gold with small white fizzy head.  Flavor is dry and grassy with a slight sweetness.  Very crisp and drinkable, clean but definitely doesn’t hide its faults.

Can. Low fluffy white and quickly disappearing head. Clear light yellow body. Mild corn malt grass marcipan aroma. Malt corn grass flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness. A bit watery though. Heavily carbonated. Short aftertaste.

How can it be pure draft out of a bottle? Dark gold body with a bright white head. The nose is slightly skunky with lots of corn and husky grain notes. The taste is very light with corn and bread crust. There is also some almond shell and club soda in the finish. A decent light brew.
Green 330mL bottle, clear faint yellow.  Skunk aroma.  Typical.  Crisp refreshing rice flavor.  Finish with a light floral.  I would definitely drink this again.  It’ll do in a pinch.
Bottled. A pale yellow beer wiu a small white head. Grainy and metalic aroma. Taste is also metalic and malty. Watery
Pours a straw yellow color with a white head.  Aroma is honey, floral, and skunk.  Flavor is floral, rice, honey, vanilla, some skunk, and almost no bitterness.

330 mL. Pours typical pale lager- short lived head, no lacing, blah blah. Aroma is sweet corn, rice, some light pineapple. The description is classic: water from China’s "old mountain" mountains. Tastes a little better than say Heineken with less chemical and grainy tastes and more fruitiness. Not bad.

Jacksonville, Fl. - Total Wine - 11.2 oz bottle. Pours a sparkling light golden with almost no head. Grainy aroma with hints of honey. Flavor has a sweet bent to it with some honey, some kids cereal - not altogether unappealing. Finishes with a bit of a grassy back end. Mouthfeel is on the thin side. Overall, though, thirst quenching and hit the spot after a long drive on a hot day.
Yellow, heavy carbonation.  Some what skunky aroma with notes of grain.  Flavor was nice and crisp, simple corn note though.  Finish was subtle and dry.

12oz bottle.  Pretty much your standard Asian Pale Lager.  Pours a clear pale yellow with a 2 finger thick off white head.  Nose of grain, skunk, and a touch of herbal hops.  Not bad with Chinese take out.

Ugh.  Very pale golden body with a nearly non-existent head.  Aroma is pure skunk that you can smell from several feet away.  Weak, watery palate.  Taste is only marginally better than the aroma.  Semi-sweet with only a hint of grassy hops.  Barely even a thirst quencher.  Maybe I’ll chug one after a very spicy bowl of General Tso’s.
Bottle. Pours a very light yellow with a white head. Aroma is skunk. With the flavor to match and an earthy finish. Yech.

Pours a light golden color with a white head.  Aroma is pretty much skunk, grass notes, and a little floral hop.  Not as much skunk on the flavor but it’s still there.  Other then that there is mostly just some grassy notes.

Poured from the bottle.  First things first, I have an instant wariness of anything in a green bottle, which to me is a sure sign of water masquerading as a beer-like beverage.  Upon opening, I was greeted by the sharp pervasive smell of skunky rice, this aroma had some legs on it too, I could smell it about five feet away.  The body  is not as pale as I was prepared to see, and was a light golden color, with a instantly diminishing head of white foam.  Mouthfeel is very light, with carbonation being mostly for show.  Flavor was tinny, but not horribly so, and was innocuous in its smoothness.  Palate was grassy and slightly metallic with little aftertaste.  Certainly a beer to drink quickly.  Meh.

First aroma after uncapping the bottle is that of light skunk akin to czech-style pislners. Big frothy foamy head. Lots of carbonation rising up from the bottom of the glass. Pale golden body color. Non-descript flavor. Would be a very nice lawnmower beer since there’s not really much flavor at all. Crisp and smooth going down. Would buy it again to pair with Asian food, but sure wouldn’t buy it again just to drink a beer.
junon is right, this is better than bud lite...but not by much.  watery, grainy, a bit bitter.  not my beer of choice to wash down my hamachi.  not at all.
This was water coloured, scented, and flavored. EVER SO SLIGHTLY. However it is better than Bud Lite.
Pours and looks a lot like Tsingtao but this version is much smoother and crisper.
Thanks to Aaron for this one.  Clear yellow body with a white head.  Aroma is pretty much just skunkiness, light pils hop aroma.  Flavor is sweet, honey, no bitterness.  Sticky, and watery.
(12oz bottle) Small white head atop crystal clear straw body.  Aroma is medium sweet, grain, some grass, light skunk.  Taste is medium sweet, bread, light grass, no aftertaste.  Watery light body.

12oz bottle, courtesy of argo0.  Thanks, Aaron!  Pours a clear, pale golden color; thin off-white head with patchy lacing.  Light aroma, with lots of skunkiness and light sugar; not terribly offensive, but not good.  Light-to-medium mouthfeel: candy sugar, light skunkiness following through from the aroma; reasonably drinkable and crisp, but kind of grainy and stale overall.  Not exceptional.  Medium finish: sugars, grainy malts, and a touch of mineral bitterness.
22 oz bottle from Country Club Liquors; clear gold with a medium white head; Nose is lightly grainy with some grassy hops; flavor only very slightly sweetand grainy witha faint hop bitterness.

Appearance: Pours a clear, pale yellow body with a small, white head.

Smell: Fresh, clean rice aroma with a waft of water-soaked grasses.

Taste: Not much to go on here, folks. Some puffed rice, some clean water, a medium sweetness, and a very slight grassy hop character. Clean, sudden finish. Just like life, it’s over before you know it.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Again, there’s not alot going on here. It’s okay, perhaps, if you’re looking for something tremendously light, but then the optimal choice would be: water.

The aroma is full of adjuncts and rather malty with a grassy hop. The appearance is pale gold with a small head. The flavor is water like with rice and grass. The palate is watery. Better than the regular with no funk but nothing great.
Slight hint of hay on the nose.  Pale yellow, almost lemon color. with decent carbonation.  Taste was light and clean.  Some slight hop flavor.  Great with Chinese food.  Very simple refreshing beer.
Pale clear straw yellow, crispy grains, lightly hopped, clean finish. No complaints when you know what you’ve signed up for.

Marginal in every way. Grassy hops with a bit of citrus.  Pours with a fizzy white heead over a yellow body. Decent retention. Tastes like rice, but decently drinkable. Watery mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Not horrible.

12 oz bottle poured into my trusty stein- poured transparent very light golden yellow, white head quickly bubbled away, medium carbonation.  Aroma of seaweed and malt, ugh.  Hits the mouth with a thin body, extremely light malt and hops, finish fades away.  The perfect beer to drink when you don’t feel like drinking beer.

Interesting find here, thanks to JRedmond.  Classified as a regular pale lager, unlike Tsingtao which is a "premium" lager.  Because the calorie content  is listed in the description, im guessing thats its selling point and its the equevelent of a Light beer.  To be honest this was pretty solid.  Given the chance, I would rather drink this.  Not a whole lot going on, but its very smooth and refreshing.

12 oz bottle split with pwn3d. I thought this was better than the original despite the rating, and lower alcohol. The body is very clear yellow. The aroma is really nothing at all. The taste is pretty smooth, nothing really offensive.
Very pale dishwater yellow color with no head. Light malt and hop flavors with a bitter aftertaste
12 ounce bottle in generic goblet.  Golden yellow with rapidly diminishing white head.  Aroma of boiled corn and soiled underwear.  Flavor?  None.  Not worth drinking.

Although I have had regular Tsingtao ff and on for years, I have only just tried this Pure Draft.  While pleasant and drinkable, it is a lot liighter, weaker, and less satisfying in every respect.  It’s close to Coors I think.  It has a small, bubbly white head that dissipates to nothing immediately.  Compared to the regular, it’s more pale yellow and much more bubbly.  It has a very weak, hardly discernable, grain aroma. The taste is very light grain and grass with a faintly lingering grain aftertaste after the first sip but this soon vanishes.  It has no bite and after a few sips becomes increasingly watery and bland (like Coors & unlike regular Tsingtao, the taste of which holds up nicely), with the flavour almost disappearing.  At least its not offensive and its drinkable and can be refreshing in the right circumstances, but I don’t think I’ll buy it again.

"Bomber". Aroma of noble type hop with some light malt. Gold color with a white head that came and went. Near medium body with fizzy/creamy carbonation. The flavor is grassy hop with light malt. A bit light on flavor, but it’s ok for the style. Finishes lightly sweetish, and the hop doesn’t really build enough to balance.
Bottle from BevMo. Light yellow in color. Aroma is skunky cardboard. Flavor is of corn and paper. Not a good combo. Pretty much garbage.

Didn’t expect to get blown away here haha. Violently skunked nose. One of the worst I’ve smelled. Like holy crap, this is a dead skunk on the side of the road bad. I’ve had my fair share of skunked lagers lately, nothing comes close to the level of offensiveness displayed here. Clear golden, large head, good lacing and retention. Flavor isn’t much better, (holy crap as I’m typing this after refilling the glass I can smell it from here...) but at least I can somehow get it down. Light body with moderate to high carbonation, light sweetness, no bitterness. Surprisingly good lacing and retention, surprisingly bad everything else. I will say that the beer has probably been sitting under a well lit shelf for at least a month, but still... unreal.

Pours a golden yellow ... very fizzy head, almost completely disappears ... smells pretty bad, skunky sweat socks comes to mind .... it is drinkable but i could of gone my whole life without this low end swill, AND it is waaay to expensive! go to hell carlos ruiz!

This looks like most of the BMC fizzy yellow brews, pale yellow with a smallish head.  After the initial skunk wafts away, there’s a very light sweet malt aroma.  No hops.  (No lead either, I hope.)  Light and highly carbonated, it has a damp bread flavor with a mild sugary sweetness and a soft bitterness that turns somewhat sour in the finish.  Once was enough.

Three Cellars, Franklin, WI
Bottle, pure skunk aroma, very light and watery, nothing special about this beer. Very light
